body:
Hi Mostapha
I'm sorry, I didn't know your script about Epw files.
I thought and made this component yesterday night. I had this idea because of a problem that I had years ago about Epw files, writing manually some values of ENVI-Met inside it. Anyway, I'm agree with you about the problem of too many components. if you want I can send you this component like it appears now, thus you can see if there are some good ideas to complete your code. My Python is still too young ;) And if you need too much time to complete your code you could write a temporary component. It works very well, I was thinking to add some others functions to read automatically the type of variable, and warnings, too. And it can edit all variables of Epw file. The principle was to create a waterfall of these components, one for each variable edited. As you can see from this image. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/18H-groRyDSV9r0JfOVvQmmPjOql1iicKQp9yTntVCEzaNrX0jEGpIDCvkxPCqDDRBcjnHF2HzeyIwIorYUn9F1dkShYbD5W/WATERFALLMETHOD.png) In this way you can track the editing. Let's talk about other ideas about this issue by email, ok? Thanks! Best Antonello
